title: Green Hay Bale Maker - Free Stock Creative Commons Video

subtasks: Prepare the seedlings
Bring seedlings to the field
Dig planting holes
Plant seedlings into holes
Cover planted seedlings with soil

tasks.task: Checking equipment operation in a field
subtasks: Approach the equipment
Inspect equipment while moving
Check oil level of equipment
Tighten any loose parts on equipment
Operate equipment to till the field

tasks.task: Preparing a riding mower for operation
subtasks: Walk to the riding mower
Check mower oil level
Check fuel level in mower
Engage mower through startup procedure
Test drive the mower to ensure proper operation

tasks.task: Loading a clay truck with hay
subtasks: Approach the hay and truck
Stack hay onto the truck bed
Secure the hay to prevent shifting
Lift and position the hay into the truck
Continue stacking until the truck is full

tasks.task: Loading a trailer with wooden blocks
subtasks: Walk to the trailer
Arrange the wooden blocks on the trailer
Tie down the blocks to secure them
Drive the blocks into position on the trailer
Stack multiple layers of blocks

tasks.task: Unloading a clay truck with hay
subtasks: Position the hay offloading equipment
Lower the hay from the truck
Separate the hay into piles
Distribute hay over a field

tasks.task: Loading a dump truck with compost
subtasks: Wait for the compost to be loaded
Inspect the compost for quality
Assist in dumping the compost into the truck bed
Confirm the compost is properly loaded

tasks.task: Unloading a dump truck with compost
subtasks: Drive the truck to the designated area
Monitor the emptying of the compost
Distribute the compost on the field
Position the power washer
Set up the water pressure
Begin washing the equipment
Rinse and dry the equipment
Carry a water hose to the greenhouse
Hook the hose to the water source
Move the hose through the greenhouse
Water the plants thoroughly
Identify the damaged section of the fence
Remove weeds or grass from around the fence
Prepare replacement fence panels
Align the new panels with existing fence
Nail or screw the new panels into place
Check the tightness of all fasteners
Gather the goats into a working area
Hold a goat securely
Trim the goat's hooves using shears or a hoof knife
Examine the hooves for issues
Repeat for each goat
Collect feed from storage bin
Fill feeders in each chicken coop
Check water levels in each coop
Distribute feed to the chickens
Wear protective gear
Enter the chicken coop quietly
Collect eggs from nesting boxes
Place collected eggs in a basket
Wipe down the nesting boxes
Inspect eggs for quality
Approach the milking area
Clean the milking area with soap and water
Apply teat dip and teat guards
Attach milking machine or udder for manual milking
Milking the goat thoroughly
Collect the milk into a container
Select compatible apple tree branches
Clean grafting tools with alcohol
Prepare the scion by making a clean cut
Prepare the rootstock by making a T-bud graft
Insert the scion into the rootstock
Secure the graft with grafting tape
Apply a wrap to protect the graft
Identify the damaged cushion
Remove the cushion from the tractor
Disassemble the cushion fabric or cover
Sew or replace the cushion fabric
Reattach the cushion to the tractor seat
Walk through the field
Examine plants for weed characteristics
Mark or remove identified weeds
Confirm the pole is broken
Signal for assistance or a vehicle
Remove surrounding soil or brush
Use a crane or equivalent to lift the pole
Take down the pole sections carefully
Dispose of the pole components
Obtain a melon
Wash the melon
Cut the melon into slices
Arrange the slices on a plate
Approach the beehives
Inspect the hives for damage
Check for signs of pests
Examine honeycomb for proper development
Replace any damaged frames

tasks.task: Delivering mail in a field, presumably a farmer doing so
subtasks: Collect mail from a mailbox
Walk from the mailbox to the delivery location
Read delivery addresses
Place mail into mailboxes along the route
Note any mail needing special handling
Clear the site of weeds or grass
Mark the position for the fence post
Use a shovel or post hole digger
Dig a deep, round hole for the post
Check the depth to ensure proper placement
Wait for the post to be set
Refill the hole with soil and tamp down

tasks.task: Working with a rope to control a hay baling machine
subtasks: Approach the hay baling machine
Determine the correct rope usage
Adjust the rope length and position
Hold the rope to guide the hay onto the baler
Assist in securing the bale once formed
